title: Mount Schutz
text: Mount Schutz () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> () rising at the east side of the head of <a href="Noll%20Glacier">Noll Glacier</a> in the <a href="Wilson%20Hills">Wilson Hills</a>, <a href="Antarctica">Antarctica</a>. Mapped by <a href="United%20States%20Geological%20Survey">United States Geological Survey</a> (USGS) from surveys and <a href="U.S.%20Navy">U.S. Navy</a> air photos, 1960–63. Named by <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> (US-ACAN) for Lieutenant Commander <a href="Albert%20C.%20Schutz">Albert C. Schutz</a>, Jr., U.S. Navy, <a href="Aircraft%20Commander">Aircraft Commander</a> in LC-117D and Co-pilot in LC-130F aircraft during <a href="Operation%20Deep%20Freeze">Operation Deep Freeze</a> 1967 and 1968.
